meanings.definition: A manuscript that is printed before the final version is published.
meanings.sent1: I read the preprints of the book before it was officially released.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often share preprints of their research to gather feedback.
meanings.sent3: The preprints of the novel were so popular that everyone wanted a copy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library filled with preprints waiting to be shared with the world.
meanings.sent5: The preprints fluttered in the wind, eager to be read by curious minds.

meanings.definition: To print a manuscript before the final version is published.
meanings.sent1: The author decided to preprints the novel to get early feedback.
meanings.sent2: Publishers sometimes preprints books to send to reviewers.
meanings.sent3: She preprints her poems to make sure they look perfect before sharing.
meanings.sent4: The printer hummed as it preprints the pages of the magazine.
meanings.sent5: The writer eagerly preprints each chapter, excited to see the final result.
